results.title: Captivated
results.creator_credit: David Squire, Piers Piers Godden and Dangerous to Know
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Rikki Beadle Blair, “Captivated” is a one-man theatre piece that tells the story of Shane, a gay black man imprisoned for murder. The monotony of his daily routine is broken by letters from a “pink” pen pal, a gay Asian man who writes to Shane as an act of charity. Their correspondence charts Shane’s personal journey from self-hatred, which has manifested in a personal history of violence, to agonised self-reflection, and finally a new found gratitude and respect for his unseen friend. Dynamically staged and produced, with a bravura performance of isolation and redemption by Blair, an award-winning actor and writer on British TV.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Squire, Piers Piers Godden and Dangerous to Know

results.title: Captain Socceroo 2-Individual Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: Individual skills coaching has 26 alternative coaching segments designed to assist the player who is practicing by himself without the aid of other players. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Socceroo 1-Team Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: John Doyle presents his famous soccer skills segments in two cassettes. “Teams skill coaching” looks at 26 different soccer skills that can be practised by teams or several players together. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Retraces the voyages of Captain Cook along the east coast of Australia from Mallacoota Inlet to Cape York, and contrasts Cook’s comments with the developments that have since taken place. Gabo island, Botany Bay, Brisgane, Bustard Bay and Rockhampton, Magnetic Island, Cape Tribulation, the Endeavour River and the present Cooktown. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics
results.creator_credit: Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To fix her broken ship Captain Huff must buy new rivets and a rudder. At the store she uses a calculator to make unit price comparisons, a 10% discount, sales tax and delivery charges. An animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics

results.title: Captain Cook safari
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and General Motors Holden
results.brief_description: General Motors Holden’s trial drivers and a Brisbane T.V. team travel from Brisbane to Cooktown in four new production model vehicles, to commemorate the bi-centenary of Captain Cook’s 100 days on the Queensland coast. They visit the points where Captain Cook’s expedition landed in 1770. Shows the different terrain and driving conditions in route. Narrated by Geoff Raymond and photographed by Ken Jacoby.

results.title: Caps for sale [B&W]
results.brief_description: This is a charming tale about a peddler whose stolen caps mean all kinds of monkey business. Whimsical illustrations and flighty trills of music reflect the storyteller’s words. Based on the book written and illustrated by Esphyr Slobodkina. Narrated by Esphyr Slobodkina.
